Dialogue: Did you think I didn't know?

Dialogue: August don't do this!

Dialogue: Shut-up. SHUT UP!

Dialogue: NO! I just don't think you're safe to be around a woman right now.

Dialogue: Marlena, come with me...

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Come on Jacob. Walk away. With Walter's help, he tears his eyes from the billowing flap and walks away, passing rubes who watch with fascination.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: The only thing that's keeping you alive right now are the rubes who saw everything. August can't risk getting rid of you here. But you better not get back on this train when we leave tomorrow night.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Shut-up Camel.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: August.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Why are we moving? We have a matinee tomorrow.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Something's gone wrong. SUDDENLY, A KNOCK ON THE DOOR. The three men immediately are on alert. Walter grabs his knife from beneath his pillow. Camel tries to shove himself behind the trunks. THE KNOCK COMES AGAIN as we hear:

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: My God. Are you all right?

Speaker: marlena
Dialogue: Looks worse than it feels.  Ha, look at the two of us. Marlena awkwardly enters the room to Walter and Camel's stares. She sees the moonshine and breaks the ice.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Why is the train moving? Marlena sits with the jug, casually talking:

Speaker: marlena
Dialogue: We're being run out. Apparently, August was so optimistic about money coming in for Rosie, he figured he'd double down and find himself a new fat lady to put him really toe to toe with Ringling...So he sent Mr. Erwin into town who finds this rather large woman in a restaurant and offers her the job. Except, she...

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Aw girl. We're all in it now.

Speaker: marlena
Dialogue: Why are you hiding that roustabout?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Because Blackie and his men don't work the performer train and they'll red-light him if they find him. He can't work anymore.

Speaker: marlena
Dialogue: My God.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Does August know where you are?

Speaker: marlena
Dialogue: No. He thinks I'm with Barbara and the girls. He won't go there.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: He can't find you. As soon as we stop - before we stop - we'll jump off and I'll take you to a hotel in town.

Speaker: marlena
Dialogue: And after that? August has all our money. Where will I go?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Marlena, I'm not leaving you. We'll find a way together. I won't let you go back to him. I promise. Marlena smiles, needing to hear him say those words. She embraces him, grateful. Jacob holds her tight, assuring;

Speaker: marlena
Dialogue: Oh Jacob, that would be wonderful. You know, I bet Ringling would take us both then - they'd be getting a vet and a star attraction - that's a sweet deal for them. Although I won't be a star but I don't care. I'll take no billing at all...We'd be safe from August if we were with Ringling.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Don't worry about him.

Speaker: marlena
Dialogue: Of course, I'd have to wait a while until I can work again...

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: marlena
Dialogue: Jacob...I'm going to have a baby. Jacob is stunned...then confused...

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Change my mind??? Oh Marlena, please...please be happy.

Speaker: marlena
Dialogue: I will...I promise...as soon as I stop being terrified. Jacob kisses her. He guides her to the ground, against the hay. She nestles in his arms.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Rest...I've got you now. Marlena tries, closing her eyes.....Then, without warning;

Speaker: barbara
Dialogue: Poor Kid...Help me with him..

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Don't you work the matinee?

Speaker: tattooed man
Dialogue: Not today. I'm fading. I gotta re- ink.

Speaker: barbara
Dialogue: Don't talk. Jacob nods. They cover him, pick him up and carry him off.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Marlena!!

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Sshh. Lie back.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Where is she? Did he hurt her?

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: I don't know. Your pupils are two different sizes. Jacob pushes himself up onto his elbows but his world spins.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I have to get Marlena. What if he--

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Jacob, look at me. You've got a concussion and you're on a moving train. There's nothing you can do. Marlena can handle him. She's done it for years...

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I have to get her.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Jacob, you can't.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: She's going to have a baby. Walter is stopped. Camel shakes his head.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Does August know?  What have you done to us?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: We're going to Ringling. Me, Marlena. You can too.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: I'm a fifth rate clown when second rate circuses are folding all over the place. Doesn't put me on top of Ringling's list. They've got a dozen of me in the wings. Speaker: camel
Dialogue: What about family? Like my son. Gotta have somebody...a mother.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Not a woman I have any use for. She's sold me to this outfit when I

Speaker: camel
Dialogue: She sold you?

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: I'm not exactly cut out for farm work. Don't worry about me..

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Do whatever you have to, Walter.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: You too, Jacob. They exchange a final look, which is a goodbye. Walter turns away from Jacob, holding Queenie to his chest. Camel looks compassionately at Jacob and says:

Speaker: camel
Dialogue: Ya poor kid. The night this train passed ya...you shoulda kept on running, I guess.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Walter? Camel?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I'm not here to cause any trouble. I'm leaving.

Speaker: august
Dialogue: Funny, I thought you already left.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I'd like to say goodbye. To the menagerie. Just a few minutes and then I'll go. August's eyes narrow. Earl waits for the outcome.

Speaker: august
Dialogue: Earl, take him to the menagerie. Thirty seconds. Then escort him out of my circus, into Altoona. Speaker: earl
Dialogue: Come on kid. When Jacob starts to exit again, something happens:

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: It's good you're going. They must have known you got back on the train last night. He tossed more than half a dozen working men.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Walter! Is he---? Instantly, Earl's expression tells Jacob it's bad news. Jacob's breathing almost stops as he listens;

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: Keep walking...They got tossed off the trestle, if you can believe it. Camel's head hit the rocks. He died right away... Jacob is heartbroken and dreads what he's about to hear. Earl pauses for a beat...this part is harder to tell:

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Why are you telling me? Earl can not find the words: it's clear the killing of these men does not sit well with him.

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: Oh Christ! Oh Shit... Earl runs back towards the Big Top.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: What is it?

Dialogue: ...These animals are now the property of Altoona and we're here to sell them to Mr. Nesci.

Dialogue: Not all of them! Some of these animals are mine, like this bull.

Dialogue: Do you have any proof? Jacob is stalled. Greg appears.

Dialogue: He's right. He's just an elephant tramp. The bull is his.

Dialogue: Gertrude. Jacob and Rosie exchange eye contact. Nesci is skeptical.

Dialogue: What happens now?

Dialogue: I convinced my dean to let me take my finals. Marlena was right. With my degree, our animals and Marlena's acts, Ringling got a sweet deal. Our son was born our first season. We named him Walter. He spent the first seven years of his life with Ringling.

Dialogue: It's the heat.

Dialogue: They're here for me. Charlie and Jacob exchange a look. Charlie understands.

Dialogue: Hi Officer, can I help you?

Dialogue: Yes, I'm hoping you can. An elderly gentleman went missing from the nursing home down the street. Staff seems to think he came here.

Dialogue: We had a lot of folks from the home today. But no, I haven't seen him. The Cop peers past Charlie and sees Jacob.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Excuse me, but who is that?

Dialogue: Oh....that's my Dad. The Cop is suspicious. Charlie covers:

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: OK, well, thanks for your time. Here's my number in case you hear of anything. Sorry to bother you. The Cop exits. Charlie returns to sit opposite Jacob. They consider this unspoken proposal:

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You sure about this? Beat as Charlie pours another shot. Then:

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I wonder if we can get you into the book of records. "Oldest man who ever ran away with the circus".

Dialogue: Nah, I'm not running away. Just coming home.
